data.Sentence_cn: 课文41  训练大象
data.Sentence: --- Lesson 41 Training elephants

data.Sentence_cn: 圈养野象的训练从什么时候开始?
data.Sentence: At what point does the training of a captive wild elephant begin?

data.Sentence_cn: 驯象有两种主要的方法，我们分别称之为强硬法和温柔法。
data.Sentence: Two main techniques have been used for training elephants, which we may call respectively the tough and the gentle.

data.Sentence_cn: 强硬法就是驱象去干活，把它打顺从为止。
data.Sentence: The former method simply consists of setting an elephant to work and beating him until he does what is expected of him.

data.Sentence_cn: 且不说道义问题，这本身就是一种愚蠢的训练方法，
data.Sentence: Apart from any moral considerations this is a stupid method of training,

data.Sentence_cn: 因为这种方法训练会使动物反感，在以后某个时期可能会变成伤人的动物。
data.Sentence: for it produces a resentful animal who at a later stage may well turn man-killer.

data.Sentence_cn: 温柔法要求在最初阶段保持较大的耐心，
data.Sentence: The gentle method requires more patience in the early stages,

data.Sentence_cn: 但这种方法可以训练出性情愉快、脾气温顺，能忠实为人服务多年的大象。
data.Sentence: but produce a cheerful good-tempered elephant who will give many years of loyal service.

data.Sentence_cn: 驯象中至关生要的是指派一名专门的驯象员，全面负责这项工作。
data.Sentence: The first essential in elephant training is to assign to the animal a single mahout who will be entirely responsible for the job.

data.Sentence_cn: 大象和狗一样，喜欢有一个专一的主人，而且会对主人产生相当深厚的私人感情。
data.Sentence: Elephants like to have one master just as dogs do, and are capable of a considerable degree of personal affection.

data.Sentence_cn: 甚至有这样的故事：训练了一半的小象，竟拒绝吃食，消瘦至死，
data.Sentence: There are even stories of half-trained elephant calves who have refused to feed and pined to death

data.Sentence_cn: 在由于不可避免的情况与他们的主人分离后。
data.Sentence: when by some unavoidable circumstance they have been deprived of their own trainer.

data.Sentence_cn: 这种极端的事例虽不可全信，
data.Sentence: Such extreme cases must probably be taken with a grain of salt,

data.Sentence_cn: 但强调了一项基本原则，象和驯象员之间的关系是驯象成功与否的关健。
data.Sentence: but they do underline the general principle that the relationship between elephant and mahout is the key to successful training.

data.Sentence_cn: 捕捉15至20岁之间年龄的大象进行驯象最为经济。
data.Sentence: The most economical age to capture an elephant for training is between 15 and 20 years,

data.Sentence_cn: 这个年龄的象差不多已能干重活，可以很快挣回饲养它的开支。
data.Sentence: for it is then almost ready to undertake heavy work and can begin to earn its keep straight away.

data.Sentence_cn: 但这个年龄的象不易驯服，因此开始阶段需要有一位强有力的老手。
data.Sentence: But animals of this age do not easily become subservient to man, and a very firm hand must be employed in the early stages.

data.Sentence_cn: 捕来拴在树上的大象，
data.Sentence: The captive elephant, still roped to a tree,

data.Sentence_cn: 每当有人走近它时，就会向前猛冲并发出尖叫，甚至一连几于都由于愤怒和恐惧而拒绝进食。
data.Sentence: plunges and screams every time a man approaches, and for several days will probably refuse all food through anger and fear.

data.Sentence_cn: 有时，把一头已驯服的象拴在旁边能给野象以信心。
data.Sentence: Sometimes a tame elephant is tethered nearby to give the wild one confidence,

data.Sentence_cn: 在大多数情况下，刚博来的象会慢慢静下来，接着开始吃食。
data.Sentence: and in most cases the captive gradually quietens down and begins to accept its food.

data.Sentence_cn: 下一步就是把象带到训练场所，
data.Sentence: The next stage is to get the elephant to the training establishment,

data.Sentence_cn: 这是一件棘手的事，需要在它两侧拴上两头驯服的大象才能完成。
data.Sentence: a ticklish business which is achieved with the aid of two tame elephants roped to the captive on either side.

data.Sentence_cn: 几只象同时训练时，
data.Sentence: When several elephants are being trained at one time,

data.Sentence_cn: 通常是把新到的安置在两头训练得很好的大象的象厩中间，
data.Sentence: it is customary for the new arrival to be placed between the stalls of two captives whose training is already well advanced.

data.Sentence_cn: 然后给它以充足的食物和水，
data.Sentence: It is then left completely undisturbed with plenty of food and water

data.Sentence_cn: 一定不要惊扰它，以便让他能适应新居的气氛，并且看到自己的同伴身上没有发生让自己担惊受怕的事。
data.Sentence: so that it can absorb the atmosphere of its new home and see that nothing particularly alarming is happening to its companions.

data.Sentence_cn: 当它进食正常了，训练就开始。
data.Sentence: When it is eating normally, its own training begins.

data.Sentence_cn: 驯练员手持一根有锋利金属尖头的长棒，站在象前。
data.Sentence: The trainer stands in front of the elephant holding a long stick with a sharp metal point.

data.Sentence_cn: 两位助手骑在驯服的象的背上，从两侧控制新捕的象，
data.Sentence: Two assistants, mounted on tame elephants, control the captive from either side,

data.Sentence_cn: 其他人唱着单调的歌声用手抚摸象的皮肤。
data.Sentence: while others rub their hands over his skin to the accompaniment of a monotonous and soothing chant.

data.Sentence_cn: 据说这是为了使象产生愉快的感觉，
data.Sentence: This is supposed to induce pleasurable sensations in the elephant,

data.Sentence_cn: 为了加强这种效果，人闪还按象的年龄性别，给以亲切的外号，
data.Sentence: and its effects are reinforced by the use of endearing epithets,

data.Sentence_cn: 如“嗬！我的孩子”、“嗬！我的爸爸”、“嗬！我的妈妈”。
data.Sentence: such as 'ho! my son', or 'ho! my father', or 'my mother', according to the age and sex of the captive.

data.Sentence_cn: 然而大象不会立刻被这些讨好的括感动，而往往是用鼻子朝各个方向猛烈地甩动。
data.Sentence: The elephant is not immediately susceptible to such blandishments, however, and usually lashes fiercely with its trunk in all directions.

data.Sentence_cn: 训练员要用有锋利金属尖的长棒控制它的这种举动，
data.Sentence: These movements are controlled by the trainer with the metal-pointed stick,

data.Sentence_cn: 象鼻子最后疼得卷了起来，以后它就很少用鼻子去进攻了。
data.Sentence: and the trunk eventually becomes so sore that the elephant curls it up and seldom afterwards uses it for offensive purposes.
